predictions.text: Either the U.S. House Judiciary Committee or the U.S. Senate Judiciary Committee will hold a public hearing in which FBI Director Kash Patel is explicitly named in the title or witness questioning as part of alleged FBI political retaliation/misuse of records, by 2026-04-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: A committee website posting (or official press release) shows a hearing held (not merely announced) by the House or Senate Judiciary Committee, and the published hearing title/summary or official transcript contains "Kash Patel" (case-insensitive) in relation to alleged FBI politicization/retaliation/misuse of records.
monitoring_signals: House/Senate Judiciary hearing calendars and press releases
Witness lists including DOJ IG, FBI officials, or whistleblowers
Requests for documents/subpoenas related to FBI records searches
predictions.rationale: Recent reporting raises salience; judiciary committees routinely respond with oversight hearings when allegations involve politicization of federal law enforcement.

predictions.text: Anthropic will publicly announce a new financing round (equity/convertible/debt) with disclosed gross proceeds of at least $5.0B (USD), by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Anthropic (or a lead investor) issues a press release/blog post, or a major business outlet reports with sourced figures, stating a completed financing round with total proceeds >= $5.0B.
monitoring_signals: Anthropic investor announcements and SEC-related filings where applicable
Term-sheet leaks/FT/WSJ/Reuters fundraising reports
Cloud/compute procurement expansions implying capital needs
predictions.rationale: AI funding intensity remains high and recent reporting suggests major VC participation, increasing odds of a large round within 6 months.

predictions.text: From 2026-01-19 close to 2026-06-30 close, the S&P 500 Equal Weight Index ETF (RSP) total return will exceed the SPDR S&P 500 ETF (SPY) total return by at least 5.0 percentage points.
predictions.verification_criteria: Using official ETF total-return calculations (price change plus distributions) from 2026-01-19 close through 2026-06-30 close, compute (RSP TR - SPY TR) >= +5.0pp.
monitoring_signals: Relative performance of mega-cap tech vs broader market breadth
Equal-weight vs cap-weight index breadth indicators
Earnings revisions dispersion and factor rotation (value/size)
predictions.rationale: If leadership continues to broaden away from megacaps, equal-weight outperformance of this magnitude becomes plausible but remains uncertain.

predictions.text: The U.S. Department of Defense will announce (press release) or award contracts totaling at least $100M (USD) in new obligations for infrastructure upgrades located in Greenland (including Pituffik Space Base), by 2026-09-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: DoD press release(s) and/or USAspending/contract award notices show new obligations with performance location in Greenland, and the summed obligated amount across the relevant awards announced/issued by the deadline is >= $100,000,000.
monitoring_signals: DoD/USSF announcements referencing Greenland, Pituffik, radar, runways, ports, or communications
Congressional defense authorization/appropriations line items for Greenland
Danish/Greenlandic government statements on base access and upgrades
predictions.rationale: Heightened Arctic security salience could accelerate concrete U.S. basing/infrastructure spend, but contracting timelines introduce meaningful uncertainty.

predictions.text: The U.S. Department of Commerce will announce a CHIPS/semiconductor incentive award (grant/loan/guarantee) of at least $3.0B (USD) to a Taiwan-headquartered semiconductor company for a U.S.-located project (fab, advanced packaging, or related), by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: A Commerce/CHIPS program press release (or equivalent official announcement) names a Taiwan-headquartered firm and states an award amount >= $3.0B for a project in a named U.S. state/site.
monitoring_signals: CHIPS program award announcements and term-sheet updates
State-level incentive packages tied to Taiwanese semiconductor projects
Company capex/site permitting milestones in the U.S.
predictions.rationale: If the U.S.-Taiwan semiconductor push continues, another large, formalized incentive package is plausible within a year.

predictions.text: A U.S. federal appellate court will issue a merits decision (published opinion) that substantively addresses the legality of at least one major Trump-era tariff program (e.g., Section 232/301/IEEPA-linked tariff authority) by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: A publicly available opinion from a U.S. Court of Appeals (or the Federal Circuit on appeal from the Court of International Trade) explicitly rules on or remands substantial questions about the legality/authority for a Trump-era tariff program (not merely procedural scheduling).
monitoring_signals: Court of International Trade and Federal Circuit dockets
Emergency motions/appeals tied to tariff implementation
Government briefs asserting statutory/constitutional authority
predictions.rationale: Trade-policy uncertainty is high; litigation pipelines make an appellate merits opinion by year-end plausible though not assured.

predictions.text: UN member states will adopt (at a diplomatic conference or UN process) a final text of an international legally binding instrument on plastic pollution that includes at least one binding control measure on plastic production and/or product design (not only reporting), by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Official UN documentation announces adoption of a plastics treaty/instrument, and the adopted text contains at least one mandatory ("shall") control obligation on production limits, phase-outs, or binding design/chemical restrictions beyond transparency/reporting-only commitments.
monitoring_signals: INC negotiating session outcomes and draft treaty bracket reductions
Major-state coalition positions (EU, U.S., China) on production caps
UNEP announcements of a diplomatic conference or final adoption
predictions.rationale: Growing evidence of systemic harms increases momentum; however, binding production controls remain politically contested, keeping confidence below 50%.

predictions.text: FedEx will publicly announce an acquisition of an automation/robotics or drone-delivery company with disclosed purchase price (or enterprise value) of at least $500M (USD), by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: FedEx press release/8-K states an acquisition in robotics/automation/drones with disclosed consideration or stated enterprise value >= $500,000,000.
monitoring_signals: FedEx earnings-call discussion of automation M&A pipeline
Robotics/drone startup sale rumors involving logistics incumbents
Capex-to-opex shifts and restructuring tied to automation strategy
predictions.rationale: Strategic narrative supports M&A, but large-ticket deals are episodic and valuation/antitrust/franchise constraints lower probability.
